edu.luc.etl.cs313.android.shapes.model

Class BoundingBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.luc.etl.cs313.android.shapes.model.BoundingBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitor<Location>

    public class BoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements Visitor<Location>
    A shape visitor for calculating the bounding box, that is, the smallest rectangle containing the shape. The resulting bounding box is returned as a rectangle at a specific location.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Location onCircle(Circle c)
      onCircle generates a bounding box rectangle starting from the upper left of the circle
      Location onFill(Fill f)
      onFill decorator calls the bounding box visitor for the correct shape inside it
      Location onGroup(Group g)
      onGroup calls the bounding box visitor for the correct shapes inside of it Once the bounding box is obtained, we find the minimum X and Y's for each box AND the maximum X and Y's (width of boxes considered) in order to create the overall-encasing box
      Location onLocation(Location l)
      onLocation grabs the bounding box for the shape encased inside of it and cross-references the location from that bounding box and the location passed in For example, if a location's shape is a circle and that circle's bounding box has X-location -50, but the X-location passed in is 200, the returned box will have X-location 150.
      Location onOutline(Outline o)
      onOutline is a decorator that returns the bounding box of the shape encased inside it
      Location onPolygon(Polygon s)
      onPolygon utilizes onGroup to create a bounding box for the group of points within a polygon
      Location onRectangle(Rectangle r)
      onRectangle supplies the bounding box for a rectangle
      Location onStrokeColor(StrokeColor c)
      onStrokeColor is a decorator that returns the bounding box of the shape encased inside it

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • onGroup

        public Location onGroup(Group g)
        onGroup calls the bounding box visitor for the correct shapes inside of it Once the bounding box is obtained, we find the minimum X and Y's for each box AND the maximum X and Y's (width of boxes considered) in order to create the overall-encasing box
        Specified by:
        onGroup in interface Visitor<Location>
        Parameters:
        g - is the group to dig through
        Returns:
        the overall group bounding box

      • onLocation

        public Location onLocation(Location l)
        onLocation grabs the bounding box for the shape encased inside of it and cross-references the location from that bounding box and the location passed in For example, if a location's shape is a circle and that circle's bounding box has X-location -50, but the X-location passed in is 200, the returned box will have X-location 150.
        Specified by:
        onLocation in interface Visitor<Location>
        Parameters:
        l - is the location passed in
        Returns:
        the bounding box for the location passed in

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
